questions.clue: In 1953, she became the first female Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, making her the world's first female head of government.
This British monarch's reign from 1837 to 1901 is known as the Victorian Era.
She was the first woman to serve as Prime Minister of Israel, holding office from 1969 to 1974.
This woman was the longest-reigning queen of Denmark from 1972 and is known for modernizing the monarchy.
After her husband's assassination in 1984, she became the leader of India and was the first woman to hold this office.
This epic poem attributed to Homer details the journey of its hero back home following the Trojan War.
In this Russian novel, Fyodor Dostoevsky explores themes of guilt and redemption through the character Rodion Raskolnikov.
Virgil's work, 'The Aeneid', follows the journey of this Trojan hero as he seeks a new homeland in Italy.
This French author penned 'Madame Bovary', a novel critiquing the bourgeoisie through the tragic life of its titular character.
Considered a masterpiece of existential literature, 'The Stranger' by this author begins with the statement, 'Mother died today.'
This company introduced the first iPhone in 2007, revolutionizing mobile communication.
This online encyclopedia, launched in 2001, allows users to edit and contribute content freely.
This 1990s invention by Tim Berners-Lee is considered the backbone of the World Wide Web.
This technology, used in cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, ensures secure, decentralized transactions.
This artificial intelligence program by OpenAI, launched in 2023, can generate human-like text and code.
This Italian dish, often topped with tomato sauce and cheese, is baked in an oven and comes in varieties like Margherita and Pepperoni.
A popular Japanese dish, this consists of vinegared rice accompanied by seafood or vegetables, often wrapped in seaweed.
Originating from India, this spicy dish typically features meat or vegetables cooked in a sauce made with yogurt, cream, and aromatic spices.
This French delicacy is made from duck or goose liver, and is often served as a pâté or mousse.
Known for its complex flavors, this traditional Mexican sauce contains chocolate and chili peppers, and is often served over meats.
This 'King of Rock and Roll' had a major hit with 'Jailhouse Rock' in 1957.
Known for its catchy chorus, 'Stayin' Alive' by this group became an anthem of the disco era in the 1970s.
Madonna's debut single that topped charts in the early 1980s was titled 'Holiday'.
This Seattle-based band, fronted by Kurt Cobain, released the groundbreaking album 'Nevermind' in 1991.
In the 2000s, 'Hey Ya!' became a massive hit for this hip hop duo known for their eclectic style and innovative music videos.

final.clue: Commissioned for a convent in Milan, this late 15th-century mural employs an innovative perspective and composition to depict a pivotal Biblical scene.
